info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 10:16AM CDT until April 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE TODAY ACROSS COASTAL PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS WITH ELEVATED TO NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS INLAND AREAS... .Relative humidity values continue to fall and wind increase this morning with these conditions persisting much of the day. Elevated to Critical fire weather conditions are occurring or will shortly develop for most of Deep South Texas today. A Red Flag Warning remains in effect for the coastal counties of Kenedy, Willacy, and Cameron, including island portions. A Red Flag Warning is now in effect for Jim Hogg and Brooks Counties. A Fire Danger Statement has been issued for the remainder of Deep South Texas. Burning of any kind should be avoided. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WINDS, VERY DRY FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR COASTAL PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 7 PM CDT this evening. * TIMING...10 AM to 7 PM. * WIND...Northeast 15 to 20 mph, with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at https://weather.gov/rgv/mapcolors#fire.
